description: This file is the entry point for the 'agno' CLI application, defining command-line commands and their handlers for managing AI agent workflows, including setup, initialization, reset, ping, configuration, workspace setting, and resource management (start, stop, patch, restart). It uses the 'typer' library for CLI interface and imports various modules for operational logic.

methods.name: setup
methods.description: Sets up the Agno environment, optionally enabling debug logs, and initializes the Agno system with login.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes or resets the Agno system, with options for reset, debug logs, and login.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the existing Agno configuration, with optional debug logs.

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Pings the Agno servers to check connectivity and authentication status.

methods.name: config
methods.description: Prints the current Agno configuration, initializing if not available.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the current directory as the active workspace, optionally with a specified workspace name.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts resources defined in a specified resources.py file, with filtering options and debug/logging controls.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops resources defined in a specified resources.py file, with filtering options and debug/logging controls.

methods.name: patch
methods.description: Updates resources defined in a specified resources.py file, with filtering options and debug/logging controls.

methods.name: restart
methods.description: Restarts resources by stopping and then starting them, with filtering options and debug/logging controls.
